href="https://docs.cyclic.sh/docs/intro" target="_blank" class="nav-link w-nav-link">Docs</a></div> <div class="nav-cta-button-container"><a href="https://app.cyclic.sh/api/login" data-w-id="bd6f9588-23b4-f07d-9f3a-b6bd5f4c31b7" class="nav-link filled w-nav-link">Sign In</a></div></nav> <div class="menu-button w-nav-button"><img src="/images/White-Menu.svg" loading="lazy" width="24" alt class="menu-icon"></div></div></div> <div><div class="section half-padding wf-section"><div class="container w-container"><div class="blog-image-header"><img src="/content/61034d0ea889c569b1d6a4fa_money_hero.jpg" alt class="image-cover"></div></div></div> <div class="section small-padding wf-section"><div data-w-id="cb94c0a0-2bab-b0c9-9da8-d93e4ab951f6" xstyle="opacity:0" class="blog-container w-container"><h1>AngelList Roll Up Vehicles: Why, What and How</h1> <div class="byline"><div class="text-block-6">By:</div> <div><div class="text-block-6">Kam Lasater</div> <a href="https://twitter.com/@seekayel" class="link-2">@seekayel</a></div> <div class="div-block"></div> <div class="text-block-5">Posted: February 23, 2022</div></div> <div class="div-block-2"><a href="#" class="link-block w-inline-block w-clearfix"><div class="html-embed share-button w-embed"></div> <div class="html-embed share-button w-embed"></div></a></div> <div class="spacer _32"></div> <div class="rich-text w-richtext"><div class="nuxt-content"><p>I recently raised a friends and family round for Cyclic and used an AngelList Roll Up Vehicle (RUV). More on the round later. Multiple founder friends have asked about my experience and why I used an RUV. Here is the Why, What and How:</p> <h1 id="tldr"><a href="#tldr" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a><strong>TL;DR</strong></h1> <blockquote> <p>A Roll Up Vehicle is a legal entity that can take investments from multiple investors or entities and then invest that money as a single entity on your companys cap table. Here are the pros and cons for using an AngelList RUV as part of a venture capital fundraising round:</p> </blockquote> <p></p> <p><img alt="" src="/content/61034dd64ba727b1f9120503_angellist_ruv.png"></p> <p>Visual depiction of how investments are rolled up onto your captable</p> <h2 id="pros"><a href="#pros" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a><strong>Pros</strong>:</h2> <ul> <li>Future rounds are simplified, exactly when most stressful</li> <li>Future rounds are cheaper ($)</li> <li>Investor's address and info is kept private</li> <li>Simplified e-signature and funding for investors and company at time of investment</li> </ul> <h3></h3> <h2 id="cons"><a href="#cons" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a><strong>Cons</strong>:</h2> <ul> <li> <p>Some additional setup for the company (~1hr)</p> </li> <li> <p>Small additional cost (now only filing fees <a href="https://www.angellist.com/blog/eliminating-fees-for-roll-up-vehicles" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">https://www.angellist.com/blog/eliminating-fees-for-roll-up-vehicles</a>)</p> </li> <li> <p>Additional complexity describing to your investor who AngelList is and how they are involved</p> </li> </ul> <h3 id="should-i-use-a-ruv"><a href="#should-i-use-a-ruv" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a><strong>Should I use a RUV?</strong></h3> <p>I would definitely recommend an AngelList RUV to anyone raising an early venture capital round where:</p> <ul> <li> <p>You expect to raise another round in the future</p> </li> </ul> <p>And one or more of these to apply:</p> <ul> <li> <p>You have 10 or more angels</p> </li> <li> <p>You have angels that do less than 4 deals a year</p> </li> <li> <p>You have angels writing checks for less than $25k</p> </li> </ul> <h3 id="cyclic---what-we-do"><a href="#cyclic---what-we-do" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a><strong>Cyclic - What we do</strong></h3> <p>As a developer the complexity to go from your local to the cloud is increasing. This is driving cloud platform selection into a pre-design time decision. We are dedicated to solving both of these problems for developers. Our goal is to let you push to deploy while making cloud environment selection a runtime decision. Sign up for the <a href="https://app.cyclic.sh/api/login" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">Cyclic Private Beta</a><br>
<a href="https://deploy.cyclic.sh/cyclic-software/starter-express-api" target="_blank"> <img src="https://deploy.cyclic.sh/button.svg"> </a></p> <h3 id="my-past-experience"><a href="#my-past-experience" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a><strong>My Past Experience</strong></h3> <p>At the last company I co-founded, we raised a convertible note and then two priced rounds over the course of 7 years. The deal terms were reasonably standard for VC deals. They included drag along provisions. We were first time founders and I think we did an "ok" job of keeping all of our investors updated on how the company was doing.</p> <p>Despite drag along rights (i.e. company able to "drag" small investors into a transaction if some percentage of shares in the company agree to the transaction), the lawyers involved with our second priced round wanted signed docs from all investors along with consent of spouse docs for any investment held by a person instead of trust or other entity. This meant that we needed to coordinate outreach to roughly ten angel investors, most of whom were non-professional angels. We needed to bring them up to speed on why we were raising, and explain we needed their signatures on documents for the round even though the company had drag along rights. Oh and by the way, we needed signatures from their spouses as well, leading them to have the same conversation with less fidelity with their spouse.</p> <p>The more experienced angels who had larger checks generally understood the process and were more likely to have entities which they used to make the original investment. So they were either less likely to have questions and most were able to be a sole signer on behalf of the entity that held the investment. The converse of this was also true. The smaller check angels were more likely to have questions, they were less familiar with what was standard and they were more likely to need signatures from a spouse. Additionally, it seemed that the less experienced angels were less engaged with email and had longer turn around times.</p> <p>In a vacuum, handling each of these conversations is manageable. However, once a closing date was set, all of these small "punch list" items seemed to bubble to the surface. It seemed that there was a spike in the length of items remaining once the date was set. The 7 to 14 days before closing are among the most stressful for a co-founder. In my experience, having extra tasks and communication on my plate was extra stress at exactly the wrong time.</p> <blockquote> <p>The 7 to 14 days before closing are among the most stressful for a co-founder... having extra tasks and communication on my plate was extra stress at exactly the wrong time.</p> </blockquote> <h3 id="why-an-ruv"><a href="#why-an-ruv" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a><strong>Why an RUV</strong></h3> <p>The RUV prevents the need to keep going back to the early angels. It is a legal structure where the angels have already agreed that someone designed by the RUV organizer will be able to sign future docs related to their investment. The designated person can sign any future fundraising documents. In my case, I am that designated signer.</p> <p>This means at the next funding round I will be able to sign on behalf of the RUV. So for a bit more time and cost upfront (and maybe a bit more complex conversation with the angels) I am able to decrease my complexity (and stress) at the time of each future funding round.</p> <h3 id="how-it-works-for-founders"><a href="#how-it-works-for-founders" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a><strong>How it works for Founders</strong></h3> <p>Sign up and on-boarding were easy. I wrote a blurb on the company, uploaded a deck or memo, filled in some deal terms, identified notable co/lead-investors, targeted raise amount, and selected how I would pay the RUV fee (either company pays or investors pay). I didnt have the exact form of the SAFE complete when I set up the RUV, it is only required at close, provided it is substantially the same terms as any of the listed co/lead investors.</p> <p>For me there was some email back and forth with the AngelList team since they were still doing a staged rollout when I signed up. I had some questions during setup and emailed with two people who work at AngelList. Both were responsive and helpful. The email support felt personal and attentive.</p> <p>My only complaints on the company product side are that the UI/UX was a bit complicated for just doing the RUV. It seemed it was more focused on syndicates and funds. If there is any "product" work for the AngelList team this is probably where it is. For example: to get to the RUV page you navigate via the "Deals" menu item and the deal is listed under my "Syndicate". This all sorta makes sense given the product is essentially a Syndicate where the fee and carry are 0%. However it doesnt really make sense when I am the company founder doing a RUV. Additionally I didnt find a way to set a per investor minimum, perhaps I just missed it in interface. These are minor points of friction but they left me with a feeling that it was still an early product that wasnt fully polished yet.</p> <h3 id="how-it-works-for-investors"><a href="#how-it-works-for-investors" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a><strong>How it works for Investors</strong></h3> <p>The investor side was smooth even for first time angels investing either personally or through an entity. The flow has e-signature to the RUV docs and the ability to enter bank account details so AngelList can initiate an ACH (electronic transfer). There is also the ability for the investors to wire if that is their preference.</p> <p>That is literally it. Smooth and easy.</p> <h3 id="thoughts-questions"><a href="#thoughts-questions" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a>Thoughts? Questions?</h3> <p></p> <p>Let me know what you think. Did you find this helpful? Do you still have questions?</p> <p></p> <p>You can: <a href="https://app.cyclic.sh/api/login" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">Signup for Cyclic</a></p> <p></p> <p>Shoot me an email: <a href="mailto:kam.lasater@cyclic.sh">kam.lasater@cyclic.sh</a></p> <p></p> <p>Give me a shout out on twitter: <a href="https://twitter.com/seekayel" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">https://twitter.com/seekayel</a></p></div></div></div></div> <section id="subscribe-form" class="subscribe-form wf-section"><div class="centered-container w-container"><h2>Subscribe to posts</h2> <p>Enter your email If you would like to get an email the next time we post.<br>We post about ~1-3x per month, and up to once a month about company news.<br></p></div> <div class="container-5 w-container"><div id="embedded-form"></div></div></section> <div class="banner wf-section"><div class="container w-container"><div class="_12-columns align-center"><div class="column desk-12"><img src="/images/Rectangle-240-copy.svg" loading="lazy" alt class="absolute-image"> <div class="cta-box"><div class="text-box _600px"><h2>Launch a hello world</h2> <p>Fork and deploy a hello world project onto Cyclic faster than it has taken to read this page. Experience the power.</p> <div class="spacer _24"></div> <a href="https://app.cyclic.sh/api/login?utm_source=www&utm_medium=web&utm_campaign=cta" target="_blank" class="button white w-button">Deploy on Cyclic </a></div></div></div></div></div></div></div> <div class="footer wf-section"><div class="spacer _64"></div> <div class="footer-container w-container"><div class="_12-columns align-top"><div class="column desk-6 tab-12"><a href="/" aria-current="page" data-ix="logo" class="footer-logo w-nav-brand w--current nuxt-link-active"><img src="/images/default-monochrome-white.svg" loading="lazy" alt="cyclic logo" class="image"></a> <p class="paragraph-small no-margin"> 2021-2022 <a href="/" aria-current="page" class="w--current">Cyclic Software</a><br></p> <div class="spacer _64"></div></div> href="https://docs.cyclic.sh/docs/intro" target="_blank" class="nav-link w-nav-link">Docs</a></div> <div class="nav-cta-button-container"><a href="https://app.cyclic.sh/api/login" width="24" alt class="menu-icon"></div></div></div> <div><div class="section half-padding wf-section"><div class="container w-container"><div class="blog-image-header"><img src="/content/62d6ceda1cb8bad773baa71e_top-wanted-frameworks.png" alt class="image-cover"></div></div></div> <div class="section small-padding wf-section"><div data-w-id="cb94c0a0-2bab-b0c9-9da8-d93e4ab951f6" xstyle="opacity:0" class="blog-container w-container"><h1>I Made The Same App 3 Times in 3 Different Frameworks... Here's What I Learned.</h1> <div class="byline"><div class="text-block-6">By:</div> <div><div class="text-block-6">Eluda</div> <a href="https://twitter.com/@eludadev" class="link-2">@eludadev</a></div> <div class="div-block"></div> <div class="text-block-5">Posted: July 26, 2022</div></div> <div class="div-block-2"><a href="#" class="link-block w-inline-block w-clearfix"><div class="html-embed share-button w-embed"></div> <div class="html-embed share-button w-embed"></div></a></div> <div class="spacer _32"></div> <div class="rich-text w-richtext"><div class="nuxt-content"><p>Angular, Svelte, Solid, React, Vue there are so many frameworks out there. And you probably dealt with <a href="https://www.reddit.com/r/webdev/comments/ux2ov8/how_do_you_guys_determine_which_frameworks_to_use/" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">the "framework dilemma"</a> at some point in your career.</p> <p>Some of us pursue React, the <a href="https://insights.stackoverflow.com/survey/2021#most-loved-dreaded-and-wanted-webframe-want" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">most popular framework</a>. And that's completely understandable, because it being famous also implies that it's the most demanded skill in the job market.</p> <p>Next up is Vue, and its second position in the popularity spectrum. Some people prefer Vue for the fact that it's so lightweight and yet so scalable, and others love its simplicity and similarity to other frameworks.</p> <p><img alt="" src="/content/62d6d1173d02703377a9cef3_top-liked-frameworks.png"></p> <p>Let's take a leap of faith and change our selection criteria from popularity to likability.</p> <p>Svelte is the most loved framework, and for good reason. Svelte places strong emphasis on developer happiness because it's so easy to pick up and has a compiler that is more efficient than its peers.</p> <p>I always wondered how different it would be to build the <strong>same app</strong> with the same features, but in <strong>3 different frameworks</strong>. For each one, I want to answer the following questions:</p> <ul> <li>How many errors will I encounter?</li> <li>How much code is there to write?</li> <li>How long does it take to build?</li> </ul> <p>We'll be exploring each of the aforementioned frameworks in its own piece, as part of a four-article series.</p> <p>We'll build a <a href="https://ithink.cyclic.app/" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">website for publicly sharing short-messages, called <strong>"ithink"</strong></a>. It's like Twitter, but with no accounts and you can't delete what you post.</p> <p></p><p data-height="600" data-default-tab="js,result" data-slug-hash="gOerqjg" data-preview="true" data-user="eludapens" class="codepen" style="height:600px;box-sizing:border-box;display:flex;align-items:center;justify-content:center;border:2px solid;margin:1em 0;padding:1em"> <span>See the Pen <a href="https://codepen.io/eludapens/pen/gOerqjg"> It's Twitter, but you can't delete.</a> by Eluda (<a href="https://codepen.io/eludapens">@eludapens</a>) on <a href="https://codepen.io">CodePen</a>.</span></p> <p></p> <script async src="https://cpwebassets.codepen.io/assets/embed/ei.js"></script> <h2 id="but-first-we-need-an-api"><a href="#but-first-we-need-an-api" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a>But first, we need an API</h2> <p>If you play around with the CodePen above, you'll quickly realize that the database is not fake.</p> <p>We actually have a <a href="https://github.com/ithink-corp/api" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">back-end side of our application</a>: it handles the storing and retrieving of simple text data. It's also built on <a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/s3/" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">Amazon's S3</a> object storage service.</p> <p>A developer would normally spend hours and hours setting-up a database like this, and it's not free either.</p> <p>Luckily for us, we get a free instance of the AWS S3 Storage when we <a href="https://app.cyclic.sh/" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">use Cyclic</a>. No credit card is required.</p> <p><a href="https://deploy.cyclic.sh/ithink-corp/api" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img alt="https://deploy.cyclic.app/button.svg" src="/content/62d6cf389192e7f60cbda7b0_button.svg"></a></p> <p></p> <h2 id="vue-the-lightweight-framework"><a href="#vue-the-lightweight-framework" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a>Vue, the lightweight framework</h2> <p>Let's start by exploring the wonders of Vue, the framework that <a href="https://vuejs.org/about/faq.html#is-vue-fast" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">claims itself to be one of the most performant frontend frameworks</a>.</p> <h3 id="creating-a-new-project"><a href="#creating-a-new-project" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a>Creating a new project</h3> <p>It's no secret that setup is one of the most important stages in a project's lifecycle. It's the very first step in the journey that transforms an idea into a real-life, working application that runs on a modern computer.</p> <p>We can all agree that creating a boilerplate from scratch is exhausting. I mean, think about all the folders, files, and code that you'd need to keep repeating, forever. No one wants to do all that work!</p> <p>Luckily, Vue does all the work for us when we run the following command:</p> <p><code>npm init vue@latest</code></p> <p>It will ask you a bunch of questions so you can create the optimal setup that best fits your project. So go ahead, and accept/reject the following questions:</p> <ul> <li>Project name: <strong>ithink</strong></li> <li>TypeScript? <strong>No</strong></li> <li>JSX Support? <strong>No</strong></li> <li>Vue Router? <strong>No</strong></li> <li>Pinia? <strong>Yes</strong></li> <li>Vitest? <strong>No</strong></li> <li>Cypress? <strong>No</strong></li> <li>ESLint? <strong>No</strong></li> <li>Prettier? <strong>No</strong></li> </ul> <p>We'll see what each of these means throughout this article.</p> <p>Next up is installation. This time, you don't have to do anything. Just kick-back, relax, and wait for <code>yarn</code> to do its work! (of course, you can also use <code>npm</code> if that's your preference)</p> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-text"><code>cd ithink yarn install # or npm install </code></pre></div> <p></p><p data-height="600" data-default-tab="js,result" data-slug-hash="oNqxVBY" data-preview="true" data-user="eludapens" class="codepen" style="height:600px;box-sizing:border-box;display:flex;align-items:center;justify-content:center;border:2px solid;margin:1em 0;padding:1em"> <span>See the Pen <a href="https://codepen.io/eludapens/pen/oNqxVBY"> vue-0</a> by Eluda (<a href="https://codepen.io/eludapens">@eludapens</a>) on <a href="https://codepen.io">CodePen</a>.</span></p> <p></p> <script async src="https://cpwebassets.codepen.io/assets/embed/ei.js"></script> <p>This command will create a dead-simple boilerplate which comes with some defaults. Go ahead and run <code>yarn dev</code> or <code>npm run dev</code> and open up <code>http://localhost:3000</code> in your browser. It's already looking great, isn't it?</p> <p>You'll see a semi-usable application describing Vue, with the addition of some links to its inner-workings.</p> <p>Unfortunately, most of this stuff is useless to us. Therefore, we'll erase most of it so that we can continue along this guide:</p> <p>Take some time to observe the folder structure. Notice the emphasis that it places on <a href="https://jamstack.org/glossary/decoupling/" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">decoupling</a>. Everything is where it's supposed to be, making it a very clean and elegant architecture to work on.</p> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-text"><code>tree . index.html package.json public favicon.ico README.md src App.vue components index.css main.js stores vite.config.js yarn.lock </code></pre></div> <p>Don't worry if this looks intimidating. We'll cover <em>all of it</em> throughout this document.</p> <h3 id="configuring-seo"><a href="#configuring-seo" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a>Configuring SEO</h3> <p>You might have noticed that the title of our document is <em>"Vite App"</em>, with no immediately obvious way of changing it.</p> <p>It turns out that this is a great opportunity for us to delve into the first element: <code>index.html</code>. You've undoubtedly already seen this filename in a billion other places, but probably not in the context of Vue.</p> <p>So let's dive into <code>index.html</code>, and update some defaults:</p> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-html"><code><span class="token doctype"><span class="token punctuation"><!</span><span class="token doctype-tag">DOCTYPE</span> <span class="token name">html</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>html</span> <span class="token attr-name">lang</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>en<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>head</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>meta</span> <span class="token attr-name">charset</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>UTF-8<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span> <span class="token punctuation">/></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span Hence, quite simply, index.html is the entry-point to our application. It's where you modify the <code><head></code> meta-tags, add class-names to the top-most elements such as <code><body></code> and <code><html></code>, and change the language of your website from English ("en") to say, French ("fr").</p> <p>It's also impossible to avoid speaking about <code><div id="app"></div></code>. As we'll see in an upcoming section, this is where all-things-Vue are injected. So let's keep on exploring!</p> <h3 id="changing-the-body-color"><a href="#changing-the-body-color" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a>Changing the body color</h3> <p data-height="600" data-default-tab="js,result" data-slug-hash="BarKMEw" data-preview="true" data-user="eludapens" class="codepen" style="height:600px;box-sizing:border-box;display:flex;align-items:center;justify-content:center;border:2px solid;margin:1em 0;padding:1em"> <span>See the Pen <a href="https://codepen.io/eludapens/pen/BarKMEw"> vue-1</a> by Eluda (<a href="https://codepen.io/eludapens">@eludapens</a>) on <a href="https://codepen.io">CodePen</a>.</span> </p> <script async src="https://cpwebassets.codepen.io/assets/embed/ei.js"></script> <p>The website we're building has an overall dark theme, meaning that the <code><body></code> color should be changed from white to dark.</p> <p>After <a href="https://tailwindcss.com/docs/guides/vite" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">configuring TailwindCSS</a>, we'll start adding these changes to our document.</p> <p>You must've already created a <code>src/index.css</code> file during your Tailwind configuration, and imported it from <code>src/main.js</code>. So, let's add our custom styles:</p> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-css"><code><span class="token comment">/* index.css */</span> <span class="token atrule"><span class="token rule">@tailwind</span> base<span class="token punctuation">;</span></span> <span class="token atrule"><span class="token rule">@tailwind</span> utilities<span class="token punctuation">;</span></span> <span class="token atrule"><span class="token rule">@tailwind</span> components<span class="token punctuation">;</span></span>
<span class="token selector">body</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> <span class="token atrule"><span class="token rule">@apply</span> bg-stone-900<span class="token punctuation">;</span></span> <span class="token punctuation">}</span> </code></pre></div> <p>As you can see, we're using the <code>@apply</code> directive to <em>apply</em> the <code>bg-stone-900</code> utility to the body. If you're not very Tailwind-savvy, <code>bg-stone-900</code> is equivalent to the following CSS declaration:</p> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-css"><code><span class="token selector">body</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> <span class="token property">background</span><span class="token punctuation">:</span> <span class="token hexcode color">#1c1917</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span> <span class="token punctuation">}</span> </code></pre></div> <p></p> <h3 id="adding-a-header"><a href="#adding-a-header" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a>Adding a header</h3> <p data-height="600" data-default-tab="js,result" data-slug-hash="qBoZvrN" data-preview="true" data-user="eludapens" class="codepen" style="height:600px;box-sizing:border-box;display:flex;align-items:center;justify-content:center;border:2px solid;margin:1em 0;padding:1em"> <span>See the Pen <a href="https://codepen.io/eludapens/pen/qBoZvrN"> vue-2</a> by Eluda (<a href="https://codepen.io/eludapens">@eludapens</a>) on <a href="https://codepen.io">CodePen</a>.</span> </p> <script async src="https://cpwebassets.codepen.io/assets/embed/ei.js"></script> <p>It's time to delve into our second-most element: App.vue. It's the top-most component of our application.</p> <p>Whatever you put inside this file will go straight into <code><div id="app"></div></code>. Remember it? We mentioned it in the last paragraph of the section that covered <code>index.html</code>. See how it all fits together? Magical!</p> <p><img alt="" src="/content/62e02ea8cb6f0b99cc5ba095_hierarchy.png"></p> <p>And with all that said, let's implement our overly-simplistic header:</p> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-html"><code><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>template</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token comment"><!-- App.vue --></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>header</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>h1</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>ithink<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>h1</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>button</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>New<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>button</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>header</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>template</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> </code></pre></div> <p>As you can see, we kept it pretty simply.</p> <p>Hey! I hid the Tailwind class-names from the code snipped above. Browse our code repository to see the full code.</p> <p><strong><em>Ahem</em></strong><em>,</em> let's address the elephant in the room. What the heck is <code><template></code>?</p> <ul> <li>Before we get into that, let me explain a fundamental concept to you.. <strong>Web components!</strong></li> <li>Web components give developers the ability to create their own tags:</li> <li><code><profile-card></code>, <code><emoji></code>, <code><close-button></code>, <code><code-editor></code></li> <li><strong><em>It's like magic!</em></strong> You get to encapsulate your own HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Web components are an elegant way to create user-interfaces that resemble native apps. They're the future of the web.</li> <li>If this sounds cool to you, you're probably wondering how to create these things.</li> </ul> <p>So let me introduce <strong>Single File Components!</strong> (SFCs)</p> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-html"><code><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>script</span> <span class="token attr-name">setup</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token script"><span class="token language-javascript"> <span class="token comment">// Javascript here</span> </span></span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>script</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>
<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>template</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token comment"><!-- HTML here --></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>template</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>
<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>style</span> <span class="token attr-name">scoped</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token style"><span class="token language-css"> <span class="token comment">/* CSS here */</span> </span></span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>style</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> </code></pre></div> <p>As you can see, SFCs split a component's design into three logical parts, and they can come in any order:</p> <ul> <li><strong>JavaScript logic:</strong> (<code><script setup></code>) The brains of your component. Handles state, events, networking, etc</li> <li><strong>HTML document:</strong> (<code><template></code>) The semantics of your component.</li> <li><strong>CSS declarations:</strong> (<code><style scoped></code>) The style of your component.</li> </ul> <p>Pretty neat, huh?</p> <h3 id="listening-to-click-events"><a href="#listening-to-click-events" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a>Listening to click events</h3> <p>As it currently stands, the "new" button doesn't do anything, and no one wants a useless button.</p> <p>So let's change that! We must listen to a click event, and <a href="https://vuejs.org/guide/components/events.html" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">in Vue, events</a> work like this:</p> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-html"><code><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>script</span> <span class="token attr-name">setup</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token script"><span class="token language-javascript"> <span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">openModal</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> <span class="token comment">// TODO</span> <span class="token function">alert</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'button clicked!'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">}</span> </span></span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>script</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>template</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>button</span> <span class="token attr-name">@click</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>openModal<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>New<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>button</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>template</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> </code></pre></div> <p>We'll come back to the openModal function later, when we actually create the modal!</p> <h3 id="creating-a-modal-component"><a href="#creating-a-modal-component" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a>Creating a modal component</h3> <p>It's time to put the src/components folder to good use. This is where we'll be housing all our custom components.</p> <p data-height="600" data-default-tab="js,result" data-slug-hash="VwXaRbb" data-preview="true" data-user="eludapens" class="codepen" style="height:600px;box-sizing:border-box;display:flex;align-items:center;justify-content:center;border:2px solid;margin:1em 0;padding:1em"> <span>See the Pen <a href="https://codepen.io/eludapens/pen/VwXaRbb"> vue-3</a> by Eluda (<a href="https://codepen.io/eludapens">@eludapens</a>) on <a href="https://codepen.io">CodePen</a>.</span> </p> <script async src="https://cpwebassets.codepen.io/assets/embed/ei.js"></script> <p>What you can see in the image above is the "New Modal" component, written into the NewModal.vue file.</p> <p>Create a new file at <code>src/components/NewModal.vue</code>. Fill it up with the usual SFC boilerplate:</p> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-html"><code><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>script</span> <span class="token attr-name">setup</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token script"><span class="token language-javascript"> <span class="token comment">// NewModal.vue</span> </span></span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>script</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>
<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>template</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>template</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>
<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>style</span> <span class="token attr-name">scoped</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token style"><span class="token language-css"> </span></span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>style</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> </code></pre></div> <p>Let's get the markup out of the way: (remember to use <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/Semantics" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">the right semantics</a>)</p> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-html"><code><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>template</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>div</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>dialog</span> <span class="token attr-name">open</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>main</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>form</span> <span class="token attr-name">method</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>dialog<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>label</span> <span class="token attr-name">for</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>content<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>Content<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>label</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>textarea</span> <span class="token attr-name">id</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>content<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>textarea</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>
<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>button</span> <span class="token attr-name">value</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>cancel<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>Cancel<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>button</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>button</span> <span class="token attr-name">value</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>default<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>Post<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>button</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>form</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>main</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>footer</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>p</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>Whatever you write will become public.<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>p</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>footer</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>dialog</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>div</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>template</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> </code></pre></div> <p>Markup alone is not very useful without the JavaScript logic. Let's attach event handlers to our button elements:</p> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-html"><code><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>script</span> <span class="token attr-name">setup</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token script"><span class="token language-javascript"> <span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">close</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> <span class="token comment">// TODO</span> <span class="token punctuation">}</span> </span></span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>script</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>
<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>template</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> ... <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>button</span> <span class="token attr-name">value</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>cancel<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span> <span class="token attr-name">@click</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>close<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>Cancel<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>button</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>button</span> <span class="token attr-name">value</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>default<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>Post<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>button</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> ... <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>template</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> </code></pre></div> <p></p> <p>Okay, this is great! But notice that when you click on "post", the page reloads. This is the default <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/form" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">behavior of HTML forms</a>.</p> <p>Normally, we'd change that by calling <code>e.preventDefault</code>. But Vue focuses so much on simplicity that there's a super-convenient shortcut:</p> <p></p> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-html"><code><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>script</span> <span class="token attr-name">setup</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token script"><span class="token language-javascript"> <span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">submit</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> <span class="token comment">// TODO</span> <span class="token punctuation">}</span> </span></span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>script</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>
<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>template</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> ... <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>form</span> <span class="token attr-name">method</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>dialog<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span> <span class="token attr-name">@submit.prevent</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>submit<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> ... <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>form</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> ... <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>template</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> </code></pre></div> <p>Would you look at that! We're able to shorten e.preventDefault() to @submit.prevent. Now, we don't even need to consider <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">the Event object</a> anymore!</p> <h3 id="tracking-a-loading-state"><a href="#tracking-a-loading-state" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a>Tracking a loading state</h3> <p>The user should know when their application is loading, whether it's posting new text to the server or just retrieving it.</p> <p>Let's create a variable that tracks when our component is sending/receiving data to/from the server. We're gonna be using <a href="https://vuejs.org/guide/essentials/reactivity-fundamentals.html" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">reactive variables</a>.</p> <p></p> <p>What is a <strong>reactive variable</strong>?</p> <ul> <li>Consider the following scenario:</li> </ul> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-javascript"><code><span class="token keyword">let</span> a <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token number">4</span> <span class="token dom variable">document</span><span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token method function property-access">getElementById</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'container'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token property-access">textContent</span> <span class="token operator">=</span> a <span class="token comment">// <p id="container">4</p></span> </code></pre></div> <ul> <li>Say that we updated the value in a to 5. One thing we know for sure is that the <code><p></code> element won't change. It will always say "4", unless we explicitly change it.</li> <li>Well, we don't have to! With <a href="https://vuejs.org/guide/essentials/reactivity-fundamentals.html" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">reactivity</a>, the DOM is automatically updated once the related variable is mutated.</li> <li>In Vue, reactive variables are created with ref, a function that takes any value and makes it reactive.</li> </ul> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-javascript"><code><span class="token keyword module">import</span> <span class="token imports"><span class="token punctuation">{</span> ref <span class="token punctuation">}</span></span> <span class="token keyword module">from</span> <span class="token string">'vue'</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> a <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token function">ref</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token number">4</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> a<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token property-access">value</span> <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token number">5</span> </code></pre></div> <ul> <li>Notice the addition of .value. It's important, because if we did a = 5 we'd completely taking away the reactivity of the variable.</li> <li>Also, it doesn't matter that a is a constant variable, because we're only assigning to its .value property.</li> <li>Now look at the HTML:</li> </ul> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-html"><code><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>template</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>p</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>{{ a }}<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>p</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>template</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> </code></pre></div> <ul> <li>Vue will replace {{ a }} with its value: a.value, and the double-brackets are <em>not</em> optional.</li> </ul> <p>Okay, let's head right back into the submit logic. We'll create a new isLoading reactive variable, which will indicate when our app is in-contact with the server.</p> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-javascript"><code><span class="token keyword module">import</span> <span class="token imports"><span class="token punctuation">{</span> ref <span class="token punctuation">}</span></span> <span class="token keyword module">from</span> <span class="token string">'vue'</span>
<span class="token keyword">const</span> isLoading <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token function">ref</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token boolean">false</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token keyword">async</span> <span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">submit</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> isLoading<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token property-access">value</span> <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token boolean">true</span>
<span class="token comment">// TODO: send data to server</span>
isLoading<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token property-access">value</span> <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token boolean">false</span> <span class="token punctuation">}</span> </code></pre></div> <h3 id="getting-user-input-from-form-elements"><a href="#getting-user-input-from-form-elements" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a>Getting user input from form elements</h3> <p>Our "new modal" component can't exist without the <code><textarea></code> form element. But this raises an important question: <em>how do we keep the javascript code in-sync with the DOM content?</em></p> <p>In a nutshell, Vue has a shortcut way of dealing with form elements. And it's quite convenient!</p> <p>As you can see, message is a reactive variable, so whenever the user types something into textarea, message will be instantly updated. That's the magic of v-model!</p> <p>Hey! You may be getting tired from typing .value all the time. Thankfully, Vue has plans to change that.</p> <h3 id="making-the-modal-inert-while-loading"><a href="#making-the-modal-inert-while-loading" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a>Making the modal inert while loading</h3> <p data-height="600" data-default-tab="js,result" data-slug-hash="QWmNogz" data-preview="true" data-user="eludapens" class="codepen" style="height:600px;box-sizing:border-box;display:flex;align-items:center;justify-content:center;border:2px solid;margin:1em 0;padding:1em"> <span>See the Pen <a href="https://codepen.io/eludapens/pen/QWmNogz"> vue-4</a> by Eluda (<a href="https://codepen.io/eludapens">@eludapens</a>) on <a href="https://codepen.io">CodePen</a>.</span> </p> <script async src="https://cpwebassets.codepen.io/assets/embed/ei.js"></script> <p>When our app is loading (which is tracked by the isLoading variable that we saw in a previous section), we should disable interaction with it.</p> <p>This requires us getting access to a DOM element in JavaScript. The pure way of doing that is with body.querySelector(), but this approach is non-reactive. Plus, there's a simpler alternative offered by Vue:</p> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-javascript"><code><span class="token operator"><</span>script setup<span class="token operator">></span> <span class="token keyword module">import</span> <span class="token imports"><span class="token punctuation">{</span> ref <span class="token punctuation">}</span></span> <span class="token keyword module">from</span> <span class="token string">'vue'</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> container <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token function">ref</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token keyword null nil">null</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token operator"><</span><span class="token operator">/</span>script<span class="token operator">></span>
<span class="token operator"><</span>template<span class="token operator">></span> <span class="token operator"><</span>div ref<span class="token operator">=</span><span class="token string">"container"</span><span class="token operator">></span><span class="token operator"><</span><span class="token operator">/</span>div<span class="token operator">></span> <span class="token operator"><</span><span class="token operator">/</span>template<span class="token operator">></span> </code></pre></div> <p>These are called <a href="https://vuejs.org/guide/essentials/template-refs.html" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">template refs</a>! And although it says null, Vue will fill container with the DOM element </p><div ref="container"> when it's created. It will also go back to null when it disappears.<p></p> <p>With this in hand, we can make our component inert while it's loading:</p> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-html"><code><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>script</span> <span class="token attr-name">setup</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token script"><span class="token language-javascript"> <span class="token keyword module">import</span> <span class="token imports"><span class="token punctuation">{</span> ref <span class="token punctuation">}</span></span> <span class="token keyword module">from</span> <span class="token string">'vue'</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> container <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token function">ref</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token keyword null nil">null</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>
<span class="token keyword">async</span> <span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">submit</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> isLoading<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token property-access">value</span> <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token boolean">true</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span> dialog<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token property-access">value</span><span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token method function property-access">setAttribute</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">"inert"</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token boolean">true</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span>
<span class="token comment">// TODO: send data to server</span>
dialog<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token property-access">value</span><span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token method function property-access">removeAttribute</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">"inert"</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span> isLoading<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token property-access">value</span> <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token boolean">false</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span> <span class="token punctuation">}</span> </span></span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>script</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>
<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>template</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>div</span> <span class="token attr-name">ref</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>container<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>div</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>template</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>
<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>style</span> <span class="token attr-name">scoped</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token style"><span class="token language-css"> <span class="token selector">dialog<span class="token attribute"><span class="token punctuation">[</span><span class="token attr-name">inert</span><span class="token punctuation">]</span></span></span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> <span class="token atrule"><span class="token rule">@apply</span> filter brightness-90<span class="token punctuation">;</span></span> <span class="token punctuation">}</span> </span></span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>style</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> </code></pre></div> <p>Hey! While there's a simpler way to achieve the above (<code><div :inert="isLoading"></code>), I just had to create an opportunity to teach you about template refs, which are a pretty important feature in VueJS.</p> <h3 id="automatically-focusing-the-textarea"><a href="#automatically-focusing-the-textarea" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a>Automatically focusing the <code><textarea></code></h3> <p data-height="600" data-default-tab="js,result" data-slug-hash="ExEKMQK" data-preview="true" data-user="eludapens" class="codepen" style="height:600px;box-sizing:border-box;display:flex;align-items:center;justify-content:center;border:2px solid;margin:1em 0;padding:1em"> <span>See the Pen <a href="https://codepen.io/eludapens/pen/ExEKMQK"> vue-5</a> by Eluda (<a href="https://codepen.io/eludapens">@eludapens</a>) on <a href="https://codepen.io">CodePen</a>.</span> </p> <script async src="https://cpwebassets.codepen.io/assets/embed/ei.js"></script> <p>When the user opens the NewModal component, we know that their objective is to input into the <code><textarea></code>. So, wouldn't it be convenient to save them the hassle of moving the cursor towards that form element?</p> <p>Let's implement this feature! Counter-intuitively, we can't do this:</p> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-html"><code><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>h1</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>blah blah<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>h1</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>script</span> <span class="token attr-name">setup</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token script"><span class="token language-javascript"> <span class="token keyword module">import</span> <span class="token imports"><span class="token punctuation">{</span> ref <span class="token punctuation">}</span></span> <span class="token keyword module">from</span> <span class="token string">'vue'</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> textarea <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token function">ref</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token keyword null nil">null</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>
textarea<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token property-access">value</span><span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token method function property-access">focus</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token comment">// this is WRONG!</span> </span></span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>script</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>
<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>template</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>textarea</span> <span class="token attr-name">ref</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>textarea<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>textarea</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>template</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> </code></pre></div> <p>The above code won't work, because it's the same as saying null.focus().</p> <p>So, how do we tell Vue to only focus the textarea once it's available? The answer lies in <a href="https://vuejs.org/guide/essentials/lifecycle.html" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><strong>lifecycle hooks</strong></a>.</p> <p><img alt="" src="/content/62e02ecd52420b19a8e6d301_lifecycle.png"></p> <p>We want to utilize the "mounted" hook, which is called right after the component is added to the DOM. That's when the <code><textarea></code> is shown, meaning that it's not null:</p> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-javascript"><code><span class="token keyword module">import</span> <span class="token imports"><span class="token punctuation">{</span> onMounted <span class="token punctuation">}</span></span> <span class="token keyword module">from</span> <span class="token string">'vue'</span>
<span class="token function">onMounted</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token arrow operator">=></span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> textarea<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token property-access">value</span><span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token method function property-access">focus</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token comment">// CORRECT! :)</span> <span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> </code></pre></div> <p>There are many more lifecycle hooks, and we usually use most of them. However, in our application, the "mounted" hook was more than enough. But just keep one thing in mind, you'll see this concept again and again in every framework.</p> <h3 id="closing-the-modal-when-clicked-outside"><a href="#closing-the-modal-when-clicked-outside" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a>Closing the modal when clicked outside</h3> <p data-height="600" data-default-tab="js,result" data-slug-hash="yLKOmKV" data-preview="true" data-user="eludapens" class="codepen" style="height:600px;box-sizing:border-box;display:flex;align-items:center;justify-content:center;border:2px solid;margin:1em 0;padding:1em"> <span>See the Pen <a href="https://codepen.io/eludapens/pen/yLKOmKV"> vue-6</a> by Eluda (<a href="https://codepen.io/eludapens">@eludapens</a>) on <a href="https://codepen.io">CodePen</a>.</span> </p> <script async src="https://cpwebassets.codepen.io/assets/embed/ei.js"></script> <p>It's a pretty common behavior in every modal to close it once the user clicks outside.</p> <p>In this step, we'll take a HUGE shortcut. Instead of manually implementing this behavior, we shall use another library to do it for us.</p> <p>The Vue community is humongous and infinitely helpful, so it's not a surprise to find a library like <a href="https://vueuse.org/functions" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">@vueuse</a>: over 200 useful methods that cover almost every possible usecase.</p> <p>Our interest lies in the [onClickOutside event](<a href="https://vueuse.org/core/onClickOutside/" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">https://vueuse.org/core/onClickOutside/</a>), which is triggered every time the user clicks outside a certain DOM element.</p> <p>After <a href="https://vueuse.org/guide/" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">setting up @vueuse</a>, let's add it to our component:</p> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-javascript"><code><span class="token operator"><</span>script setup<span class="token operator">></span> <span class="token keyword module">import</span> <span class="token imports"><span class="token punctuation">{</span> ref <span class="token punctuation">}</span></span> <span class="token keyword module">from</span> <span class="token string">'vue'</span> <span class="token keyword module">import</span> <span class="token imports"><span class="token punctuation">{</span> onClickOutside <span class="token punctuation">}</span></span> <span class="token keyword module">from</span> <span class="token string">'@vueuse/core'</span>
<span class="token comment">// Close dialog when clicked outside</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> container <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token function">ref</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token keyword null nil">null</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token function">onClickOutside</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span>container<span class="token punctuation">,</span> close<span class="token punctuation">)</span>
<span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">close</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> <span class="token comment">// TODO</span> <span class="token punctuation">}</span> <span class="token operator"><</span><span class="token operator">/</span>script<span class="token operator">></span>
<span class="token operator"><</span>template<span class="token operator">></span> <span class="token operator"><</span>dialog ref<span class="token operator">=</span><span class="token string">"container"</span><span class="token operator">></span><span class="token spread operator">...</span><span class="token operator"><</span><span class="token operator">/</span>dialog<span class="token operator">></span> <span class="token operator"><</span><span class="token operator">/</span>template<span class="token operator">></span> </code></pre></div> <p>Fascinating how in one line of code, we're able to implement such a seemingly complicating feature!</p> <h3 id="closing-the-modal"><a href="#closing-the-modal" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a>Closing the modal</h3> <p>The modal has no way of telling whether its opened or closed, as only its parent App.vue knows such information.</p> <p>But there's one thing we know to be true, and it's that the modal knows <em>when</em> it should be closed:</p> <ul> <li>user clicked outside,</li> <li>user submitted,</li> <li>user canceled.</li> </ul> <p>Therefore, we need a way for the child NewModal to communicate with its parent, App. And the solution is quite simple: <a href="https://vuejs.org/guide/components/events.html" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">Events</a>!</p> <p>With Vue, it's super-simple to define our own events, while dictating when they should be emitted, using <em>our</em> own rules.</p> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-javascript"><code><span class="token keyword">const</span> emit <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token function">defineEmits</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">[</span><span class="token string">'close'</span><span class="token punctuation">]</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>
<span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">close</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> <span class="token function">emit</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'close'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">}</span> </code></pre></div> <p>Henceforth, whenever the modal needs to be closed, we emit the event "close" up into its parent.</p> <p>Hey! Notice how we didn't import defineEmits. That's because it's a compiler macro, so it's always there by default.</p> <h3 id="using-our-custom-component"><a href="#using-our-custom-component" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a>Using our custom component</h3> <p>Up until now, you couldn't see NewModal, because it hasn't been added to App.vue yet. So, let's change that:</p> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-javascript"><code><span class="token operator"><</span>script setup<span class="token operator">></span> <span class="token keyword module">import</span> <span class="token imports"><span class="token maybe-class-name">NewModal</span></span> <span class="token keyword module">from</span> <span class="token string">'./components/NewModal.vue'</span> <span class="token operator"><</span><span class="token operator">/</span>script<span class="token operator">></span>
<span class="token operator"><</span>template<span class="token operator">></span> <span class="token operator"><</span><span class="token maybe-class-name">NewModal</span> <span class="token operator">/</span><span class="token operator">></span> <span class="token operator"><</span><span class="token operator">/</span>template<span class="token operator">></span> </code></pre></div> <p>With the code snippet above, the modal will always be open. So, let's add some toggle magic:</p> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-javascript"><code><span class="token operator"><</span>script setup<span class="token operator">></span> <span class="token keyword module">import</span> <span class="token imports"><span class="token maybe-class-name">NewModal</span></span> <span class="token keyword module">from</span> <span class="token string">'./components/NewModal.vue'</span> <span class="token keyword module">import</span> <span class="token imports"><span class="token punctuation">{</span> ref <span class="token punctuation">}</span></span> <span class="token keyword module">from</span> <span class="token string">'vue'</span>
<span class="token keyword">const</span> isModalOpen <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token function">ref</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token boolean">false</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>
<span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">openModal</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> isModalOpen<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token property-access">value</span> <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token boolean">true</span> <span class="token punctuation">}</span> <span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">closeModal</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> isModalOpen<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token property-access">value</span> <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token boolean">false</span> <span class="token punctuation">}</span> <span class="token operator"><</span><span class="token operator">/</span>script<span class="token operator">></span>
<span class="token operator"><</span>template<span class="token operator">></span> <span class="token operator"><</span><span class="token maybe-class-name">NewModal</span> v<span class="token operator">-</span><span class="token keyword control-flow">if</span><span class="token operator">=</span><span class="token string">"isModalOpen"</span> <span class="token operator">/</span><span class="token operator">></span> <span class="token operator"><</span><span class="token operator">/</span>template<span class="token operator">></span> </code></pre></div> <p>We took advantage of <code>v-if</code> to show/hide the modal.</p> <p>And now we're done with the NewModal component. Pretty simple, huh?</p> <h3 id="creating-a-dynamic-list-of-dom-elements"><a href="#creating-a-dynamic-list-of-dom-elements" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1"><span class="icon icon-link"></span></a>Creating a dynamic list of DOM elements</h3> <p data-height="600" data-default-tab="js,result" data-slug-hash="jOzqgpr" data-preview="true" data-user="eludapens" class="codepen" style="height:600px;box-sizing:border-box;display:flex;align-items:center;justify-content:center;border:2px solid;margin:1em 0;padding:1em"> <span>See the Pen <a href="https://codepen.io/eludapens/pen/jOzqgpr"> vue-7</a> by Eluda (<a href="https://codepen.io/eludapens">@eludapens</a>) on <a href="https://codepen.io">CodePen</a>.</span> </p> <script async src="https://cpwebassets.codepen.io/assets/embed/ei.js"></script> <p>It's time to delve into a new component, ThoughtList. This one will display a list of items, and we don't know the length of that list before-hand.</p> <p>Let's create a new file at <code>src/ThoughtList.vue</code>. In Vue, here's how we repeat an element:</p> <div class="nuxt-content-highlight"><pre class="line-numbers language-html"><code><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>script</span> <span class="token attr-name">setup</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token script"><span class="token language-javascript"> <span class="token keyword module">import</span> <span class="token imports"><span class="token punctuation">{</span> ref <span class="token punctuation">}</span></span> <span class="token keyword module">from</span> <span class="token string">'vue'</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> items <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token function">ref</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">[</span><span class="token string">'hello'</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token string">'world!'</span><span class="token punctuation">]</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> </span></span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>script</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>
<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>template</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>ul</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>li</span> <span class="token attr-name">v-for</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>item in items<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"><</span>p</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>{{ item }}<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>p</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>li</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>ul</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation"></</span>template</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span> </code></pre></div> <p>Surprisingly simple!
